operatinglosscarryforwardsexpirationdate: If not utilized, the U.S. federal net operating loss carryforwards and the state and local net operating loss carryforward will expire between 2027 and 2030; and the U.S. foreign tax credit carryforward will expire in 2022.

sharebasedcompensationarrangementbyshare: RSUs are generally granted annually and generally vest at a rate of 50% after two years and 50% after three years and convert into shares of common stock at the vesting date.
SARs generally expire 10 years after the grant date.
operatinglosscarryforwardsexpirationdate: If not utilized, the U.S. federal net operating loss carryforwards and the state and local net operating loss carryforward will expire between 2027 and 2030.

sharebasedcompensationarrangementbyshare: The 2010, 2009 and 2008 grants of SARs to key employees vest ratably over 5 years (i.e., 20% per year)
These awards generally expire 10 years after the grant date.
descriptionofcreditriskderivativeactivit: Provide protection against the first $1 million of realized credit losses in a $10 million portfolio of exposure
variableinterestentityqualitativeorquant: In conjunction with the Bear Stearns merger, in June 2008, the Federal Reserve Bank of New York ("FRBNY") took control, through an LLC formed for this purpose, of a portfolio of $30.0 billion in assets, based on the value of the portfolio as of March 14, 2008. The assets of the LLC were funded by a $28.85 billion term loan from the FRBNY and a $1.15 billion subordinated loan from JPMorgan Chase.
changesinfairvaluebasedontenpercentageor: Changes in fair value based on a 10% or 20% variation in assumptions

taxcreditcarryforwardexpirationdates: If not utilized, the U.S. foreign tax credit carryforward will expire in 2020
definedbenefitplantargetallocationpercen: Currently, approved asset allocation ranges are: U.S. equity 15–35%, international equity 15–25%, debt securities 10–30%, hedge funds 10–30%, real estate 5–20%, and private equity 5–20%.
